dynamicPhrasesNote: Pour les rêves personnalisés, ces 4 phrases sont générées dynamiquement par Mistral et ElevenLabs

phrases.text: Close your eyes.
One breath in...
Let it drop.
Feel your weight against whatever's holding you. You're here.
Say it silently. Notice what your body does.
Scan. Jaw. Throat. Chest. Gut. Legs.
You're looking for tension, heat, cold, a knot, an emptiness. Find it.
Stay there. Don't fix it. Just feel its texture — dense? Electric? Hollow? Heavy?
Your body locked this away to protect you. That was survival. But the protection became the prison.
Now let the sensation spread. Don't contain it. Wherever it wants to go — let it.
If your body wants to twitch, tremble, sigh — let it. That's your nervous system processing what your mind understood years ago.
Breathe into that space. In...
Out through your mouth. Not to force anything out. Just to give it room to leave.
Notice what's different. Not fixed. Different. That's the shift.
Wiggle your fingers. Open your eyes.
You just answered what your dream was telling you.
Welcome back.
Your dream pointed at something specific: a deep need for control in the face of uncertainty.
This infinite mall represents your search for direction in a world that feels chaotic. Being lost reflects your fear of never finding your path.
At some point in your past, you felt the ground crumbling beneath you. That you had no control over what was happening.
You don't need to find the exit. The peace you're looking for is already within you.
Your dream pointed at something specific: a feeling of powerlessness in the face of danger.
Running through molasses represents those moments when you feel you cannot escape what frightens you. Your heavy legs carry the weight of your emotional burdens.
At some point in your past, you felt trapped. Unable to scream, unable to run, unable to protect yourself.
Your voice was never gone. It's just waiting for you to give it permission to speak.
Your dream pointed at something specific: a deep fear of being exposed and judged.
Your crumbling teeth represent your fear of losing control of your image. The blood you taste is the price you pay for maintaining appearances.
At some point in your past, you were taught that showing your flaws was dangerous. That you always had to appear perfect.
Your worth was never in your teeth, your appearance, or your ability to hold it all together. It exists beyond any facade.
